comment: An interval-closed set ` A ` in a total order has the same subspace topology as the restricted order topology. (An interval-closed set is the same thing as an open or half-open or closed interval in ` RR ` , but in other sets like ` QQ ` there are interval-closed sets like ` ( _pi , +oo ) i^i QQ ` that are not intervals.)
